title: Charlie's Euro predictions
text:
Wins for Man City and Spurs but Man Utd and Leicester will lose, says Charlie Nicholas Last Updated: 20/02/17 11:27pm Charlie Nicholas previews this week's European action Charlie Nicholas provides us with his Champions League and Europa League predictions with four Premier League sides in European action this week. 
Manchester City and Leicester both open up their last-16 ties against Monaco and Sevilla respectively, while Tottenham and Manchester United have contrasting tasks on their hands in their Europa League second legs. 
Jose Mourinho's United have a healthy 3-0 lead to defend when they head of St Etienne, which has been moved to Wednesday night due to a clash with neighbours Lyon, while Spurs will need to overcome a 1-0 deficit when Gent visit Wembley. 
Here's what Charlie is predicting... 
Manchester City v Monaco (Tuesday, 7.45pm) 
We know Monaco are a dangerous team now. They used to be very cautious and structured as a counter-attacking side and now they've scored 76 goals in Ligue 1. Everybody is raving about Kylian Mbappe-Lottin but we'll see how he performs on the big stage. 
It feels like there's more belief in the Manchester City camp though. The defence is obviously still not right but they did look like they had a bit of a stronger core against Bournemouth, although I still don't like Yaya Toure in the defensive-midfield role. Pep Guardiola faces the press ahead of his side's clash with Monaco 
I think if Pep Guardiola weighed things up he'd probably rather win the Champions League and I'm confident they'll go far. 
I think we'll get something else from Sergio Aguero because he knows he's got a good run back in the team if he plays well but Pep will drop him again if his level drops. Nicholas is expecting a good showing from Man City striker Sergio Aguero (C) 
I'm looking at City to win by a couple of goals and I'd back Kevin de Bruyne to break the deadlock because he's a big-game player. Agree with Charlie? Follow his Sky Bet tips here. 
Sevilla v Leicester (Wednesday, 7.45pm) 
You can see the annoyance and anger in Claudio Ranieri's face but is he changing things for the positive? Have they all stopped listening? There's so much going on at the club. Claudio Ranieri takes his Leicester side to Sevilla 
If you look at what got them into this competition it was their spirit, togetherness and absolute hunger and I don't see much of that left in them. I keep mentioning the centre-backs as their big problem and I think he should try a back five. 
I don't really think Leicester have got much of a chance and people are suggesting it could be a thrashing but I think if they sit in with a packed defence and leave a bit of pace up top then they can limit the damage. 
Charlie predicts: 2-0 and Vitolo to score first (22/1 with Sky Bet) 
St Etienne v Manchester United (Wednesday, 5pm) 
The job is done with a 3-0 win at Old Trafford, even though they didn't play well that well in the first leg. 
I've been to St Etienne a few times as a fan and while they don't get huge numbers it's quite a hostile stadium to go into. Zlatan Ibrahimovic celebrates after scoring the 17th hat-trick of his career against St Etienne 
With the cup final coming up at the weekend, Paul Pogba and Zlatan Ibrahimovic will be rested. I think Jose Mourino will still go with a strong backline though to ensure they've got a solid base. 
Charlie predicts: 1-0 and Hamouma to score first (45/1 with Sky Bet) 
Tottenham v Gent (Thursday, 8.05pm) 
Tottenham were dreadful last Thursday but they found a way to bounce back against Fulham, which I thought as a dangerous tie. Tottenham must overcome a one goal deficit against Gent 
When Harry Kane, Christian Eriksen and Heung-Min Son are getting on the ball early then you know they are going to cause problems, and that was the difference between the two teams. 
They've got Stoke at home on Sunday so I think he'll give a few more fringe players a chance than in the FA Cup, but Gent are an average team and I wouldn't be surprised if Spurs won 3-0 even with a few changes.
